title: The Archaeology of Anxiety (2016).pdf Gooner
description:
The Archaeology of Anxiety - The Materiality of Anxiousness, Worry and Fear (2016).pdf Gooner

Publisher: Springer; 2016 edition (4 Jan. 2016)
Language: English
ISBN-10: 1493932306
ISBN-13: 978-1493932306

Recent developments in archaeological theory have led to the recognition that emotions play a direct role in the processes of how a society forms: a group of people band together as they fear outside forces attacking them. This also applies to personal behavior as well: wanting the sun to come up in the morning and the rituals conducted because of that.

Yet research on emotion in archaeology remains limited, despite the fact that such states underpin many studies of socio-cultural transformation. The Archaeology of Anxiety draws together papers that examine the local complexities of anxiety as well as the variable stimuliâ€•class or factional struggle, warfare, environmental degradation, resource exhaustion, and personal turmoil, responsibilities to the deadâ€•that may generate emotional responses of agitation, anxiousness, and concern.

The goal of this timely volume is to present fresh research that addresses the material dimension of rites and performances related to the mitigation and negotiation of anxiety, as well as the role of material culture in constituting and even creating periods or episodes of anxiety
